reviews.review_msg: I think she means well, and she is very nice, but seriously dull lectures.  I didn't learn much from lecture, and found most of the notes not useful for assignments.  If I didn't have an awesome T.A. I would have been lost.  I can't believe I spent ~$60 per class for those lectures.

Professor Scott Timecke is smart and sophisticated in his course. He is too smart, which makes the students to have a bit distance from him. Also, he is a bit rude in his way of communication. Perhaps, some humility is needed to achieve full potentials.

At first it may seem like you're doomed for the rest of the semester but Scott isn't really all that bad. He always has good inputs on your assignments, but can also give you the honest, brutal truth of what else is lacking in your work.

I understand the bad reviews, but at the same time I don't. First, Scott can easily come across as stuffy - but I think the accent does a lot of that for him. He's also into modernity... which I'm not a fan of. BUT he is smart and he really wants his students to do well. He grades a little nicer than fair. In the end bad students deserve bad grades

Roman knows a lot. A LOT. He also likes to tackle problems head on. This seems to result in him doing minimal prep for some classes, leading to some confusion as lessons get mixed or disappear all together into incredibly entertaining stories about himself. This is the only negative thing I can say about him. He is great in every other way.
yay roman.  he's the best prof of all time.

It seems to be true, you either love Roman or hate Roman. I love Roman. I think his lectures are insightful, and he is very committed to his students. I like that he doesn't follow overheads and stick to a specific regimen. His classes are unique and I don't attribute that to disorganization. If you are committed, you'll succeed in his class.

Funny and easy-going, but totally unorganized (due to laziness) and provide unclear assignment instructions for students. I wouldn't recommand taking his lower level courses; take upper courses with him instead.

Prof Harasim is smart. She explains things, people just stress themselves out and get confused. Very valuable CMNS info if you pay attention,  and you'll do fine if you make the effort. Don't act like a kid and she won't treat you like one. People are just so needy.

DO. NOT. TAKE. THIS. CLASS. Linda is a great person but she talks to you like you are in high school. If you just want the credits and don't care about GPA then it's not too bad. Although she claims she is objective and open to new ideas, she is not. You should definitely do your project according to her interests to get a good mark.
Linda is a good person, and a good prof, very knowledgeable with privacy and social media. Easy course with 6 credits! Highly recommend,

Linda is a good pro. And her research course is very cool. Her class is like a free discussion, which have no slides and projectors, I enjoyed her class. However, since there is no slides, she sometimes missing informations, and won't admit if it leads to a problem.

Nawal is a great professor. Originally I had heard some things about her, but from my experience she was wonderful. She is very passionate and open minded about many subjects, and really wants you to succeed. She's a bit strict, but I enjoyed that as she keeps you on track and was always available for extra help; as well as gives great feedback!
One of the greatest prof. in the school
Nicest prof I've ever had and will prolly ever have
